item.title: PlayStation State of Play November 2025 live report - keep up with everything and pray for Bloodborne here
item.content:encoded:
Happy Bloodborne remake day! Wait let's not get ahead of ourselves. Sony's delivering a State of Play broadcast this evening from 10pm UK time and we'll be covering all of the announcements, as they happen, right here in this article. It's like magic and it's very handy for if you're out but don't want to miss out.

What's more - and as if you needed any encouragement - you can chat along with us. Tell us what you think and how you think the show is going. Give it a rating out of 10 if you like. You don't even have to use a star system.

So what's Sony's plan for the evening? The show will be 40 minutes long and focus on PS5 games made in Japan and Asia, Sony said yesterday, "alongside a few other exciting updates". The PS5 is just turning five years old, incidentally, which could provide Sony with a moment for a meaningful announcement.

And what more meaningful announcement is there to make, you say, than a Bloodborne remake? What indeed, fair reader, what indeed! After all, wasn't Bloodborne made in Japan? The stars are aligning. The stage is set. Do it, Sony, you cowards - do it!

Ahem.

PlayStation at 10pm, then. Join us (or risk missing a piece of history!).

  • 16:53 pm 11/11/2025 The build-up to Sony's five-year PS5 anniversary show



https://www.eurogamer.net/playstation-state-of-play-november-2025-live-report-keep-up-with-everything-and-pray-for-bloodborne-here

item.title: Looks like Lego's next The Legend of Zelda set will be based on Ocarina of Time
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo and Lego have teased a new set based on The Legend of Zelda, which looks to be based on Ocarina of Time.

A teaser video shared by both companies shows a Lego minifigure of Link in his iconic garb, with a floating Navi the fairy. He's overshadowed by a horned figure (Ganon), while a Lego Zelda is out of focus in the background behind flames.

"Do you realise who you're dealing with?" the post reads, with the set due some time next year.

Details of the set remain unknown, but considering the video clearly depicts the final battle between Link and Ganon from Ocarina of Time, it's very likely the set will be based on this scene and include these figures.

As previously shared on reddit by BrickTap, the set is rumoured to be an Ocarina of Time Ganondorf diorama made of 1003 pieces that will release on 1st March 2026.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

The set would be the second based on The Legend of Zelda, following last year's Great Deku Tree set featuring both Ocarina of Time and Breath of the Wild designs.

Earlier this year, Nintendo and Lego released its Lego Game Boy set, launched with a trailer that recreated its famous 'Robot' commercial of 1989.

Next year, a series of Pokémon sets will be released, as revealed back in March, though they're looking pricey.

The forthcoming Animal Crossing: New Horizons update will also include a Lego collaboration with which to decorate your in-game home.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/looks-like-legos-next-the-legend-of-zelda-set-will-be-based-on-ocarina-of-time
